intro: Chaerophyllum villarsii subsp. alpestre, commonly known as the alpine cow parsley, is a herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in mountainous areas. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white flowers arranged in umbels. Its botanical features make it well adapted to cold, harsh environments.
